Package processing

Class DoubleInsertionTSP

java.lang.Object
processing.DoubleInsertionTSP
public class DoubleInsertionTSP
extends java.lang.Object
Heuristic-based pickup-delivery traveling salesman problem (TSPPC) solution adapted from the paper "A heuristic for the pickup and delivery traveling salesman problem" of J. Renaud, F. F. Boctor and J. Ouenniche (2000). Only the first part is implemented here, and in the case of our application, it does not seem relevant to try to optimize the solution computed any further.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    (package private) static class  DoubleInsertionTSP.AssembleOrder
    Ways of assembling a given path A-B-C-D to which we removed the 3 edges A-B, B-C and C-D, these 4 letters each representing a portion of this path, made up of one or more vertex(es), without considering cases that can be reduced as 2-opt cases (when an edge that has been removed is added back at the same place and in the same direction as before).
    private class  DoubleInsertionTSP.DeltaI
    Class used as the return of the method computing the delta_i of a given request on the current path.
    (package private) static class  DoubleInsertionTSP.InsertionMethod  
    private class  DoubleInsertionTSP.ThreeOptCuts
    Class used to represent a 3-integers tuple corresponding to the 3 cut points in the sub-path used in 3-opt optimization.

  • Method Details

    • doubleInsertionHeuristic

      public void doubleInsertionHeuristic()
      First step of the algorithm : Iteratively building an initial tour by inserting one by one each request and applying a local optimization after each insertion.

    • minWeightedInsertionCost

      private DoubleInsertionTSP.DeltaI minWeightedInsertionCost​(Request request)
      Computes the 'minimum weighted insertion cost' (delta_i) for a given request given the current state of the tour. Used in parts 1.2 and 2.2 of the main algorithm.
      Parameters:
      request - The request for which we compute delta_i
      Returns:
      delta_i, the minimum weighted insertion cost of the best combination found, as well as the position(s) and method of insertion
      See Also:
      DoubleInsertionTSP.DeltaI

    • threeOptCost

      private float threeOptCost​(int cut1, int cut2, int cut3, DoubleInsertionTSP.AssembleOrder order)
      Compute the cost of the given 3-opt permutation according to the given method of assembling. This cost corresponds to the length of the sub-path considered after being reordered according to the given method, that is to say the length of the path starting at index cut1 and ending at index cu3 + 1 included. This sub-path is made up of 2r+1 vertices (points) and the edges connecting them.
      Parameters:
      cut1 - The index in the current tour of the point from which we 'cut' the first edge.
      cut2 - The index in the current tour of the point from which we 'cut' the second edge.
      cut3 - The index in the current tour of the point from which we 'cut' the third edge.
      order - The order according to which we reorder the sub-paths obtained after cutting the first sub-path.
      See Also:
      DoubleInsertionTSP.InsertionMethod, doubleInsertionHeuristic()

    • applyThreeOptIfValid

      private boolean applyThreeOptIfValid​(int cut1, int cut2, int cut3, DoubleInsertionTSP.AssembleOrder order)
      Applies the reordering method given to the current tour (once its cost evaluated) ONLY IF the resulting path is valid (if each pickup is visited before its associated delivery).
      Parameters:
      cut1 - The index in the current tour of the point from which we 'cut' the first edge.
      cut2 - The index in the current tour of the point from which we 'cut' the second edge.
      cut3 - The index in the current tour of the point from which we 'cut' the third edge.
      order - The order according to which we reorder the sub-paths obtained after cutting the first sub-path.
      Returns:
      true if the given optimization has been applied (= if it was valid), else false
      See Also:
      DoubleInsertionTSP.InsertionMethod, threeOptCost(int, int, int, AssembleOrder)

    • allPossibleCuts

      private java.util.ArrayList<DoubleInsertionTSP.ThreeOptCuts> allPossibleCuts​(int center)
      Generate each possible combination of cutting 3 edges in the sub-path of length 2r+1 centered around center for the 3-opt local optimization.
      Parameters:
      center - The index in the current tour of the point around which the sub-path is centered
      Returns:
      A list of all possible sets of 3 points (their indexes in the current tour) from which we can 'cut' an edge and apply the 3-opt method.
      See Also:
      DoubleInsertionTSP.ThreeOptCuts

    • buildTour

      public Tournee buildTour()
      Build an use-ready Tournee object from the current tour.
      Returns:
      The fully usable Tournee object

    • longueurEntre

      private float longueurEntre​(int depart, int arrivee)
      Return the length of the shortest path between 2 points according to matAdj.
      Parameters:
      depart - The index in matAdj of the starting point of the desired path
      arrivee - The index in matAdj of the arrival point of the desired path
      Returns:
      The length of the shortest path between depart and arrivee

    • longueurCheminEntre

      private float longueurCheminEntre​(int depart, int arrivee)
      Compute the length of the sub-path in the current tour between the given starting and arrival points, possibly by taking it backwards if arrivee < depart.
      Parameters:
      depart - The index in the current tour of the starting point of the desired path
      arrivee - The index in the current tour of the arrival point of the desired path
      Returns:
      The length of the desired path
      See Also:
      longueurEntre(int, int)

    • ajouterPointTournee

      private void ajouterPointTournee​(TupleRequete tupleRequete, int index)
      Add a given point to the current tour at a given index.
      Parameters:
      index - The index in the current tour where the point is to be inserted (its index after insertion)
      tupleRequete - The point to be inserted

    • ajouterPointTournee

      private void ajouterPointTournee​(TupleRequete tupleRequete)
      Overload of the identically-named method to add a point directly to the end of the current tour.
      Parameters:
      tupleRequete - The point to add at the end ot the tour
      See Also:
